intro: Cachrys scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Cachrys scabra typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and roadsides. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in temperate climates.
